intro: Commiphora sarandensis, commonly known as the Sarandian myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It produces a resinous sap that has been traditionally used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Commiphora sarandensis thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils.
